save cypher as ENCODED variable for decrypt
save cypher as ENCODED variable for decrypt
write encoded pass to randomly generated filename
reads cypher file as binarized data
trim newline character off of binary conversion.
add 0 in bit 1 to disguise binary format (confuses interpreters)

Action.Str:
Task: ar.getKey Description: Tests for AutoRemote package, then gets this devices key and stores it in global variable 'AROWNKEY' for usage in remote ssh tasks for responding to device after lengthy operations, such as media viewing. Usage: 'ar.getKey'
REQUIREMENTS plugin:AutoRemote
Ah, it doesn't appear that Auto Remote is installed. This will be a requirement for full functionality of my remote media management capabilities. Shall I open it in Goole Play Store for you?
Loading Play Store. Please restart this after your purchase is complete.
Purchase AutoRemote from Google Play Store (4.99) to use this task! https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.joaomgcd.autoremote
Do you wish to continue with limited functionality?
Exiting task. Please re run this task later either after downlaoding Auto Remote or to continue with a few limitations.
%say Purchase AutoRemote from Google Play Store (4.99) to use this task! https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.joaomgcd.autoremote

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VA: <StringArray sr=""><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0>%err Error Code Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES0><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1>%errmsg Error Message Only available if you select <b>Continue Task After Error</b> and the action ends in error</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES1><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2>%arownname Name of the device you're holding Name of the device you're holding</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES2><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3>%arownkey Personal key of the device you're holding Personal key of the device you're holding</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES3><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4>%arservicewifi Status of the wifi service <b>true</b> if Wifi service is enabled, <b>false</b> if not</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES4><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES5>%arservicebt Status of the bluetooth service <b>true</b> if bluetooth service is enabled, <b>false</b> if not</_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES5><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES6>%arids() Device Ids </_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES6><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES7>%arnames() Device Names </_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES7><_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES8>%artypes() Device Types </_array_net.dinglisch.android.tasker.RELEVANT_VARIABLES8></StringArray>

Action.Str: I wasn't able to acquire this device's Auto Remote key, which is neccesary to receive communications from the remote media servers. One moment while I figure this out.
Speed control sliders locked! (move both together)
Speed control sliders unlocked!! (move each individually)

Vals.net.dinglisch.android.tasker.extras.VARI: Command Keypair_File Address Port Username Password

Action.Str: Error: No pin set! Set the pin number with the text box 'Pin', and the value with the 'Value' textbox.
Error: No value set! Set the pin number with the text box 'Pin', and the value with the 'Value' textbox.
Error: No write mode set! Use the checkboxes to set the write mode (digital or analog).

echo "http://autoremotejoaomgcd.appspot.com/sendmessage?key=%AROWNKEY&message=roverState.on" > AROWNKEY.NIC ; acm=$(ls /dev/ttyACM*) ; if [ -n "$acm" ]; then dev="$acm"; fi ; usb=$(ls /dev/ttyUSB*) ; if [ -n "$usb" ]; then dev="$usb"; fi ; if [ -n "$dev" ]; then sudo chmod 777 "$dev"; else echo "Error: No serial device found!"; exit 1; fi ; sudo motion -c "%conf"
